billing_tag_ids.description: The list of billing tag IDs.

block.description:
Manage Internet Exit.

An internet exit is an exit from the CXP to theinternet and allows the traffic fromthe various Users & Sites or Cloud Connectors toflow towards the Internet.

billing_tag_ids.description: A list of Billing Tag by Id associated with the connector.

cxp.description: The CXP where the connector should be provisioned.

segment_id.description: The Id of the segment associated with the connector.

size.description: The size of the connector. one of `SMALL`, `MEDIUM` and `LARGE`.

vpn_mode.description: The connector can be configured either in `ROUTE_BASED` or `POLICY_BASED`.

customer_gateway_ip.description: The IP address of the customer gateway.

enable_tunnel_redundancy.description: indicates to Alkira that health for the site should be reported as good as long as any one of the tunnels is up.

preshared_keys.description: An array of presharedKeys, one per tunnel.

dpd_delay.description: Interval to check the liveness of a peer.

dpd_timeout.description: Timeouts to check the liveness of a peer. IKEv1 only.

esp_life_time.description: Maximum IPsec ESP lifetime if the IPsec ESP does not rekey.

ike_dh_group_numbers.description: Diffie Hellman groups to use for IKE SA, one of `MODP1024`, `MODP2048`, `MODP3072`, `MODP4096`, `MODP6144`, `MODP8192`, `ECP256`, `ECP384`, `ECP521`, `CURVE25519`

ike_encryption_algorithms.description: Encryption algorithms to use for IKE SA, one of `AES256CBC`, `AES192CBC`, `AES128CBC`.

ike_integrity_algorithms.description: Integrity algorithms to use for IKE SA, one of `SHA1`, `SHA256`, `SHA384`, `SHA512`.

ike_over_time.description: Maximum IKE SA lifetime if the IKE SA does not rekey.

ike_random_time.description: Time range from which to choose a random value to subtract from rekey times.

local_auth_type.description: Local-ID type - IKE identity to use for authentication round, one of `FQDN`, `USER_FQDN`, `KEYID`, `IP_ADDR`.

remote_auth_type.description: Remote-ID type - IKE identity to use for authentication round, one of `FQDN`, `USER_FQDN`, `KEYID`, `IP_ADDR`.

replay_window_size.description: IPsec replay window for the IPsec SA.

block.description: The endpoint.
Policy options, both on-prem and cxp prefix list ids must be provided if vpnMode is `POLICY_BASED`

availability.description: The method to determine the availability of static route. The value could be `IKE_STATUS` or `IPSEC_INTERFACE_PING`.

bgp_auth_key.description: BGP MD5 auth key for Alkira to authenticate Alkira CXP (On Premise Gateway).

customer_gateway_asn.description: The customer gateway ASN to use for dynamic route propagation.

prefix_list_id.description: The id of prefix list to use for static route propagation.

block.description: Routing options, type is `STATIC`, `DYNAMIC`, or `BOTH` must be provided if `vpn_mode` is `ROUTE_BASED`

disable_advertise_on_prem_routes.description: Additional options for each segment associated with the connector.

disable_internet_exit.description: Enable or disable access to the internet when traffic arrives via this connector.

block.description: Additional options for each segment associated with the connector
Manage IPSec Connector.

Manage AWS credential for authentication.

The following methods are supported:

 - Static credentials
 - Environment variables

*** Static Credentials:

Static credentials can be provided by adding an `aws_access_key`and `aws_secret_key` in-line in the AWS provider block.

*** Environment Variables:

You can provide your credentials via the `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID` and`AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`, environment variables, representing yourAWS Access Key and AWS Secret Key, respectively.

Manage Cisco SD-WAN credential for authentication.

The following methods are supported:

 - Static credentials
 - Environment variables

*** Static Credentials:

Static credentials can be provided by adding an `username`and `password` in-line in the CISCO SD-WAN block.

*** Environment Variables:

You can provide your credentials via the `CISCO_SDWAN_USERNAME` and`CISCO_SDWAN_PASSWORD`, environment variables, representing yourCisco SD-WAN username and password, respectively.

Manage groups

Groups can contain one or many connectors across different segments. This grouping of connectors can be for policy enforcement purposes or for monitoring purposes within the network. It allows for easier policy assignment by assigning policies to the entire group at the same time instead of having to assign them individually.

fqdn_prefix.description: User provided FQDN prefix that will be published on route53.

group_id.description: ID of the auto generated system group.

name.description: The name of the internet application.

private_ip.description: The private IP associated with the internet application.

private_port.description: The private port associated with the internet application.

segment_id.description: The ID of segment associated with the internet application.

size.description: The size of the internet application, one of `SMALL`, `MEDIUM` and `LARGE`.

block.description:
Manage Internet Application.

The internet facing applications could be used with bothUsers & Sites or Cloud Connectors.

from_groups.description: IDs of groups that will define source in the policy scope

rule_list_id.description: The `rulelist` that will be used by the policy.

segment_ids.description: IDs of segments that will define the policy scope.

to_groups.description: IDs of groups that will define destination in the policy scope.

block.description: Manage policy.

description.description: The description of the prefix list.

name.description: The name of the prefix list.

block.description: Manage policy prefix list.

description.description: The description of the policy rule.

dscp.description: The dscp value can be `any` or between `0` to `63` inclusive.

dst_ip.description: A single destination IP as The match condition of the rule.

dst_ports.description: Destination ports that can take values: `any` or `1` to `65535`.

dst_prefix_list_id.description: The ID of prefix list as destination associated with the rule.

internet_application_id.description: The ID of the internet application associated with the rule. When an internet applciation is selected, destination ip and port will be the private ip and port of the application.

name.description: The name of the policy rule.

protocol.description: The following protocols are supported, `ICMP`, `TCP`, `UDP` or `ANY`.

rule_action.description: The action that is applied on matched traffic, either `ALLOW` or `DROP`. The default value is `ALLOW`.

rule_action_service_ids.description: Based on the service IDs, traffic is routed to the specified services.

rule_action_service_types.description: Based on the service type, traffic is routed to service of the given type.

src_ip.description: A single source IP as The match condition of the rule.

src_ports.description: Source ports that can take values: `any` or `1` to `65535`.

src_prefix_list_id.description: The ID of prefix list as source associated with the rule.

block.description:
Manage policy rule.

This resource is usually used along with policy resources:`policy_prefix_list`, `policy_rule_list` and `policy`control the network traffic.

asn.description: The BGP ASN for the segment.

block.description:
This resource manages segments.

A Segment is a section of a network isolated from one anotherto make it possible to more effectively control who has accessto what. Segmentation also allows for segregation of resourcesbetween segments for security and isolation purposes.

billing_tag_ids.description: Billing tag IDs to associate with the service.

max_instance_count.description: Max number of Panorama instances for auto scale.

min_instance_count.description: Minimal number of Panorama instances for auto scale. Default value is `0`.

panorama_enabled.description: Enable Panorama or not. Default value is `false`.

segment_ids.description: IDs of segments associated with the service.

size.description: The size of the service, one of `SMALL`, `MEDIUM`, `LARGE`.

tunnel_protocol.description: Tunnel Protocol, default to `IPSEC`, could be either `IPSEC` or `GRE`.
